newsitem.title: USA: Dover Downs cuts IPO estimated price range.
newsitem.headline: Dover Downs cuts IPO estimated price range.

text.p: Dover Downs Entertainment Inc cut the estimated price range for its initial public offering to $15 to $17 a share, according to a September 12 filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
The company, which operates the Dover Downs International Speedway and a raceway in Dover, Delaware, had estimated its price range at $18 to $21 in its initial filing on July 15.
Merrill Lynch is the lead manager of the offering, which analysts expect will fetch premiums. The deal is tentatively scheduled for this week.

Dover Downs will offer one million shares in the offering and selling shareholders will offer 1.5 million, according to the filing. The company plans to trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "DVD".
